[Portrait]<Ramza>[Dialog]
The gate stands open. I've not seen
a trap so plain.{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
Nor I.{END}

[Portrait]Aliste[Dialog]
Beowulf, at last! I'd near
grown tired of waiting.{END}

Aliste!{END}

I thought to ease your passage within,
but I see my hospitality is met with scorn.

No matter. I'd not planned to let you pass
beyond here.{END}

The effects should have taken hold
by now.

Let us treat with steel!{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
Lay aside your sword!
I've no wish to fight you!{END}

[Portrait]Aliste[Dialog]
Ha! Have you lost your edge in all these
years of chasing after that girl?{END}

[Portrait]Aliste[Dialog]
Are you truly the same knight once hailed
as Lionel's finest?
My contract ends with your last breath.
Stay not your hand-I shall not stay mine.{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
Where gone is the noble Ser Aliste-
the knight I once trusted with my life?{END}

That man has long since passed!{END}

[Portrait]Aliste[Dialog]
Mayhap your edge is not lost after all.{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
We've fought enough, Aliste!
Will you not end this madness?{END}

It's not over. Not yet...{END}

[Portrait]Aliste[Dialog]
I am...defeated.{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
Aliste!{END}

Dwell not on this, Beowulf. My days
were already at an end.

*chuckle* Even the noble Ser Aliste
cannot best malady.{END}

What?{END}

I'd not die...in a sickbed, succumbed
to weakness and...and infirmity.

What...what are you doing? Go!
Go...and save Reis!

She awaits you within. Take her...and
your freedom.

I die now...fulfilled. Fare-well,
Beowulf...my lord...{END}

You fool!{END}

[Portrait]Beowulf[Dialog]
No...! I must...save Reis...{END}
